page.title: 01EDUCATION
page.content: Lingfield First School was built in 1954. There are 181 pupils between the ages of 4 years and 8 years. Children here learn basic subjects e.g. reading, writing mathematics, science and art. Part of each day is also given to both religious and physical education. Lingfield Middle School was opened in 1971 in a building which once housed a secondary school. There are 278 pupils in the school between the ages of 8 and 12 years. Children travel to this school from Dormansland in the East and Blindley Heath to the West.French ,Craft and Home Econimics are introduced at this school. On leaving pupils transfer to Oxted County School some 12 kilometres away. Notre Dame Convent School is an independant day and boarding school for girls between the ages of 4 and 18
